intro: Allophylus cambessedei, commonly known as the Cameroon hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from yellow to red. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. Allophylus cambessedei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
